column4: how can i chage screen resolution, when i manualy edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf, nothing happens, an from menu, there are only 640x480 available, nothnig else, help ?
open a terminal
and type "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" and choose your rez wisely
that not worked.... ehere is problem maybe in drivers....
do the dpkg-reconfigure thing and choose VESA for the drive
ok i try...
tell us your hardware specifications please
if you choose the VESA driver, it should work fine, now i'm thinking you have a problem somewhere else
: what is vertikal refresh rate an horizontal ? what must i write there ?
just accept the default answer
: than i dont now where is problem.... i have blan black screen....
what kind of monitor do you have? lcd or tube?
: CRT
what is the name of your video card?
if you've chosen the VESA driver, and still have nothing i am at a loss
check your messages, he sent a private message to you
ubotu is a robot
ubotu is not alive, it is a program
read what ubotu said about resolution
ubotu is a robot
